title: Alchemical Emblems: Visual Knowledge Transmission
description: The great emblem books of alchemy where visual imagery conveys esoteric knowledge: Splendor Solis's illuminated plates, the Rosarium's archetypal images analyzed by Jung, Mylius's comprehensive medical-alchemical synthesis, and the 'silent book' Mutus Liber.
keyWorks: Splendor Solis: Pinnacle of alchemical illumination art with 22 allegorical plates
Rosarium Philosophorum: Images extensively analyzed by Jung in Psychology and Alchemy
Mylius Basilica: Comprehensive medical-chemical synthesis with emblematic illustrations
Atalanta Fugiens: 50 alchemical emblems each with musical fugue
Mutus Liber: 'Silent Book' conveying the Work entirely through images
researchValue: Essential for understanding visual communication of alchemical knowledge. Jung's interpretation of Rosarium images makes this collection foundational for psychological approaches to alchemy.
